Larry Sabato said the Republican takeover of the House of Representatives gives the Bill Clinton a new political lease on life. Once the Tea Party members of the House start having a full airing of their views, Barack Obama will appear more moderate. He's going to be nicely positioned between the old Barack Obama and the new Republican House. Now he has someone to blame and someone to make him to look better. Nokia will contribute its mapping technology to Microsoft's Bing search engine-- and integrate its application and content store into the Microsoft Marketplace. Nokia also will contribute its expertise on hardware design, language support, and help bring Windows Phone to a larger range of price points, market segments and geographies, according to a Microsoft news release. "The partnership announced today provides incredible scale, vast expertise in hardware and software innovation and a proven ability to execute," Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer said in the statement
